PHASE SUMMARY — Abbe Busoni — late

Role: 
The Abbe Busoni is a mysterious figure who appears at the window, and is later revealed to be the one who has been imprisoned and freed by Lord Wilmore.

Traits: 
- The Abbe Busoni is described as a "strange apparition" and is initially unknown to Caderousse.
- He is dressed in a black dress and a three-cornered hat, which is later revealed to be a disguise.

Relationships: 
- The Abbe Busoni has a relationship with Caderousse, who is surprised and intimidated by his appearance.
- The Abbe Busoni is also related to Monte Cristo, who is revealed to be his liberator.

Notable behaviors: 
- The Abbe Busoni is able to enter the room without being detected, suggesting that he is skilled and stealthy.
- He is able to remain motionless and silent, even when Caderousse is startled by his appearance.
- He is later able to speak and interact with Caderousse, revealing his identity and his story.
